trans-unit.source: Allows you to specify the personalization provider and set personalization authorizations.

<xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsPersonalization> provides configuration support for personalization options for Web Parts, such as the personalization provider and personalization authorizations.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsPersonalization"></xref> class using default settings.
This constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code.
It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.
An instance of this class is available from the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsSection.Personalization%2A> property.
Gets an <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationSection"></xref> object containing the Web Parts personalization authorizations for the current Web application.
There must be at least one valid verb associated with each <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule> object in the collection.
An <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationSection"></xref> object containing the Web Parts personalization authorizations for the current Web application.
Gets or sets the name of the default Web Parts personalization provider.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebPartsPersonalization.Providers%2A> property contains the Web Parts personalization providers for the current Web application.
The name of the default Web Parts personalization provider.
Gets a <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> collection that contains the Web Parts personalization providers for the current Web application.
Web Parts personalization providers can only be defined at the Web-application level (in a Web.config file).
A <xref href="System.Configuration.ProviderSettingsCollection"></xref> collection that contains the Web Parts personalization providers for the current Web application.
